name: Permanent Battery Storage Rebate
description: $7,500 rebate on permanent battery storage; must have experienced 5+ Enhanced Powerline Safety Settings outages since January 1, 2023; must be enrolled in Automated Demand Response and on time-of-use rate plan
fullDescription: PG&E offers a substantial rebate for permanent home battery storage to customers who have experienced frequent Enhanced Powerline Safety Settings (EPSS) outages, helping them maintain power reliability.
whatTheyOffer:
- $7,500 rebate for permanent battery storage
- For customers with 5+ EPSS outages since Jan 2023
- Must enroll in Automated Demand Response
- Must be on time-of-use rate plan
- Can combine with SGIP incentives
- Covers Tesla Powerwall, Enphase, and other systems
howToGetIt:
1. Use PG&E lookup tool to check EPSS outage history
2. Must have 5+ outages since January 1, 2023
3. Enroll in Automated Demand Response program
4. Switch to time-of-use rate plan
5. Apply and get approved before installation
6. Install qualifying battery storage system
keywords: battery storage, rebate, PG&E, EPSS, Tesla Powerwall, outage, backup power, $7500, home battery
